SENT.plain: It is commonly believed that strokes occurring in patients with sickle cell disease are due to abnormalities involving the small intracranial vessels, that is, at the level of small venules, capillaries, and precapillaries
The authors present a case of multiple major intracranial arterial disease in a 14-year-old boy with sickle cell disease
The angiographic findings and the pathophysiology of arterial changes are discussed along with a review of the literature
This report emphasizes that patients with sickle cell disease may present with major intracranial arterial involvement as a prominent feature
